Sentencas: The operating temperature of solid oxide fuel cells, oxygen division membranes, and oxygen sensors is determined by oxide-ion electrolytes.
Titulo: Synthesis and Electrical Behavior of Sodium Doped Monoclinic SrSiO3

Sentencas: There is a strong incentive to reduce the operating temperature in solid oxide fuel cells, from 800 degrees C to 500 degrees C.
Titulo: Synthesis and Electrical Behavior of Sodium Doped Monoclinic SrSiO3

Sentencas: The use of low-cost Na+ instead of K+ as dopant in monoclinic SrSiO3 offers a wider solid solution range (0.1< 0.5) in Sr1-xNaxSiO3-delta and obtains an oxide ion conductivity of 10(-2) Scm(-1) at 600 degrees C, reducing the temperature of a smooth transition to full impairment of mobile oxide ions.
Titulo: Synthesis and Electrical Behavior of Sodium Doped Monoclinic SrSiO3

Sentencas: For electrochemical characterization, the flat surfaces of the pellets were pasted with silver (Ag) paste and then sintered at 1200 degrees C for 24 hours.
Titulo: Synthesis and Electrical Behavior of Sodium Doped Monoclinic SrSiO3

Sentencas: The production of the Na2Si2O5 phase was observed for most compositions due to thermal treatment.
Titulo: Synthesis and Electrical Behavior of Sodium Doped Monoclinic SrSiO3

Sentencas: Crystallization of Na2Si2O5 from glass was obtained in single-step calcination at 850 degrees C after synthesis in an acetone medium, resulting in the highest conductivity.
Titulo: Synthesis and Electrical Behavior of Sodium Doped Monoclinic SrSiO3

Sentencas: Although double calcination reduced conductivity, it improved thermal stability.
Titulo: Synthesis and Electrical Behavior of Sodium Doped Monoclinic SrSiO3

Sentencas: Due to its low activation energy and lack of crystallization of other silicates, this material showed maximum conductivity after long-standing maturity at 600 degrees C. Ethanol was used in place of acetone for powder assimilation and double calcination was also performed.
Titulo: Synthesis and Electrical Behavior of Sodium Doped Monoclinic SrSiO3
